copy.headline: What is Gwei?

microcopy.text: Gwei, a blend of the words wei and giga, a unit prefix for billion, is another denomination of ether, the digital currency used on the Ethereum blockchain network.
microcopy.purpose: Defines Gwei through etymology and function; connects to previous Wei concept

microcopy.text: By virtue of how gas prices function and are denoted, Gwei is the most commonly used unit of ether. As gas is the pricing value deemed necessary to execute a contract or other form of transaction on the Ethereum network, gwei is needed to pay for the computational power.
microcopy.purpose: Explains why Gwei matters practically; connects abstract concept to real use case

microcopy.text: The standard transaction fee is 21,000 gwei on the Ethereum blockchain network.
microcopy.purpose: Provides concrete reference point with actual value
